refnamediv.refpurpose: deploys an environment on the given nodes

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: kadeploy deploys the specified environment on the requested nodes. When successfully over, the nodes are available under the new and freshly installed environment.

It needs critic variables to be defined in the /etc/kadeploy/deploy.conf configuration file ; see configuration file section for further details. If you want to know how to deploy real environment see kadeploy-environment (1).

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: -e, --environment environment_name the name of the environment to deploy
-m, --machine hostname specifies a host. This option can be used more than once to specify several hosts. By default, it tries to deploy on all the nodes.
-p, --partition partition the target partition. This option can't be used more than once and the partition is the same for all the nodes.

refsect1.title: CONFIGURATION FILES
refsect1.para: /etc/kadeploy/deploy.conf Contains variables that MUST be defined prior to the command execution.
You can man it and an example of this file can be found at in the tools/cookbook/ folder of the installation directory.

refsect1.title: FILES
refsect1.para: kadeploy needs read and write access to several folder and files to acheive a deployment. These rights should be granted to the deploy user. Here are the files and folder list :
the tftp folder where grub and pxe files will be put is configured in : /etc/kadeploy/deploy.conf configuration file and /tmp/ for a few temporary files.

refsect1.title: EXAMPLE
refsect1.para: kadeploy -e debian -l deploy -m node7 -p 3 deploys the debian on partition hda3 of node 7
kadeploy yoyz@slack -m node1 -m node2 -p 6 deploys the slack environment of the user yoyz on partition 6 of nodes 1 and 2
